com.ratio.deviceService

Class BTLEDeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ratio.deviceService.BTLEDeviceManager

  • public class BTLEDeviceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    the device manager controls the the devices through the Android Bluetooth interface. It contains the bluetooth manager and adapter, and the list of devices which have been discovered. It maintains a background looper thread. which is needed to receive callbacks from the bluetooth scan, which reports discovered devices through ScanCallback, and through the BluetoothGattCallback, which is a per-device callback. It uses a timer to "ping" the looper thread. TODO: determine if the timer can be disabled after the scan phase

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BTLEDeviceManager.BTDeviceInfo
      there is a 1:1 relationship between a bluetooth device and a bluetooth gatt.
      protected class  BTLEDeviceManager.ConnectionTimeoutTimerTask
      unfortunately, somtimes BTLE just doesn't want to connect, doesn't give any errors, just doesn't do a damn thing, so we have to set a timer which gives up when a specified time elapses.
      static interface  BTLEDeviceManager.DeviceManagerCallback

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect(BTLEDeviceManager.BTDeviceInfo deviceInfo)
                   throws com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException
        Disconnects an existing connection or cancel a pending connection. The disconnection result is reported asynchronously through the BluetoothGattCallback#onConnectionStateChange(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt, int, int) callback.
        Throws:
        com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException

      • readCharacteristic

        public boolean readCharacteristic(BTLEDeviceManager.BTDeviceInfo deviceInfo,
                         BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
                           throws com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException
        Request a read on a given BluetoothGattCharacteristic. The read result is reported asynchronously through the BluetoothGattCallback#onCharacteristicRead(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt, android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic, int) callback.
        Parameters:
        characteristic - The characteristic to read from.
        Throws:
        com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException

      • readCharacteristic

        public boolean readCharacteristic(java.lang.String address,
                         java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                         java.util.UUID characteristicUUID)
                           throws com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceNameNotFoundException,
                                  com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException
        call to read a characteristic from a service published by a device. Note the actual value is returned by the callback interface for onCharacteristicRead()
        Parameters:
        address - device MAC address (XX:XX:XX)
        serviceUUID - service unique ID
        characteristicUUID - characteristic unique ID (within the service
        Returns:
        BluetoothGatt.readCharacteristic() true/false
        Throws:
        com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceNameNotFoundException
        com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException

                                   throws com.ratio.exceptions.DeviceManagerException

        Parameters:
        characteristic - Characteristic to act on.
        enabled - If true, enable notification. False otherwise.
        immediate - setNotification immediately, don't enqueue
